{"step_by_step_thinking": "The anal canal is supplied by three arteries: the superior rectal artery, which is a continuation of the inferior mesenteric artery; the middle rectal artery, which is a branch of the internal iliac artery; and the inferior rectal artery, which is a branch of the internal pudendal artery. Therefore, all of the options listed supply the anal canal.", "answer_choice": "D"}
